ca.eandb.jmist.math

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.eandb.jmist.math.Matrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class Matrix
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A two dimensional matrix.
    Author:
    Brad Kimmel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • at

        public double at(int row,
                 int col)
        Gets the element at the specified position in this Matrix.
        Parameters:
        row - The row of the element to obtain (must be non-negative and less than this.rows()).
        col - The column of the element to obtain (must be non-negative and less than this.columns()).
        Returns:
        The element at the specified row and column in this Matrix.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if row or col is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • transpose

        public Matrix transpose()
        Gets the transpose of this Matrix (i.e., the Matrix T such that this.at(i, j) == T.at(j, i) for all i, j with 0 <= i < this.rows() and 0 <= j < this.columns().
        Returns:
        The transpose of this Matrix.
        See Also:
        at(int, int), rows(), columns()

      • slice

        public Matrix slice(int row,
                    int col,
                    int rows,
                    int cols)
        Gets a view of a sub-matrix of this Matrix (i.e.,
        Parameters:
        row - The index of the first row of the sub-matrix (must be non-negative).
        col - The index of the first column of the sub-matrix (must be non-negative).
        rows - The number of rows of the sub-matrix (must be non-negative and satisfy row + rows <= this.rows()).
        cols - The number of columns of the sub-matrix (must be non-negative and satisfy col + cols <= this.columns()).
        Returns:
        The Matrix, T, with rows rows and cols columns satisfying T.at(i, j) == this.at(row + i, col + j) for all i, j with 0 <= i < rows and 0 <= j < cols.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if row is negative, col is negative, rows is negative, cols is negative, row + rows > this.rows(), or col + cols > this.columns().
        See Also:
        at(int, int), rows(), columns()

      • diagonal

        public Matrix diagonal()
        Gets a column vector of the diagonal elements of this Matrix (i.e., the elements this.at(i, i) for 0 <= i < Math.min(this.rows(), this.columns())).
        Returns:
        The column vector of the diagonal elements of this Matrix.
        See Also:
        at(int, int), Math.min(int, int)

        public Matrix row(int row)

        The specified row of this Matrix.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if row is negative or if row >= this.rows().

        public static Matrix zeros(int rows,
                           int cols)
        Gets a Matrix consisting of all zeros.
        Parameters:

        cols - The number of columns in the Matrix (must be non-negative).
        Returns:
        The zero Matrix with the specified dimensions.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.

                          int cols)

        cols - The number of columns in the Matrix (must be non-negative).
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • constant

        public static Matrix constant(int rows,
                              int cols,
                              double value)
        Gets a Matrix with each element having the same value.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the Matrix (must be non-negative).
        cols - The number of columns in the Matrix (must be non-negative).
        value - The value to use for all of the elements of the matrix.
        Returns:
        The Matrix with all elements having the same value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.

        Returns:

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative.

      • columnMajor

        public static Matrix columnMajor(int rows,
                                 int cols,
                                 double[] elements)
        Creates a Matrix with the specified values in column-major order.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the Matrix (must be non-negative).
        cols - The number of columns in the Matrix (must be non-negative).
        elements - The elements of the Matrix in column-major order (must have at least rows * cols elements -- additional elements will be ignored).
        Returns:
        The rows by cols Matrix consisting of the elements specified.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if elements.length < rows * cols.
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.

      • rowMajor

        public static Matrix rowMajor(int rows,
                              int cols,
                              double[] elements)
        Creates a Matrix with the specified values in row-major order.
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the Matrix (must be non-negative).
        cols - The number of columns in the Matrix (must be non-negative).
        elements - The elements of the Matrix in row-major order (must have at least rows * cols elements -- additional elements will be ignored).
        Returns:
        The rows by cols Matrix consisting of the elements specified.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if elements.length < rows * cols.
        IllegalArgumentException - if rows or cols is negative.

      • multiply

        public static void multiply(Matrix A,
                            Matrix B,
                            MatrixBuffer R)
        Computes the product of two matrices. It is expected that neither A nor B are not backed by the same array as R, and that the elements of R are backed by distinct array elements. Results are undefined if these conditions are not met.
        Parameters:
        A - The left Matrix operand
        B - The right Matrix operand
        R - The MatrixBuffer to store the result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if A.columns() != B.rows().
        IllegalArgumentException - if A.rows() != R.rows() or if R.columns() != B.columns().
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • multiplyElements

        public static void multiplyElements(Matrix A,
                                    Matrix B,
                                    MatrixBuffer R)
        Computes the product of two matrices element-wise. It is expected that the elements of R are backed by distinct array elements whenever the corresponding elements of A or B are backed by distinct array elements. Results are undefined if these conditions are not met. Note that R may share its backing array with either A, B, or both, as long as the indexing is the same (e.g., both are in row-major order, both are in column-major order, etc.).
        Parameters:
        A - The left Matrix operand
        B - The right Matrix operand
        R - The MatrixBuffer to store the result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if A, B, and R do not all have the same dimensions.
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • divideElements

        public static void divideElements(Matrix A,
                                  Matrix B,
                                  MatrixBuffer R)
        Computes the quotient of two matrices element-wise. It is expected that the elements of R are backed by distinct array elements whenever the corresponding elements of A or B are backed by distinct array elements. Results are undefined if these conditions are not met. Note that R may share its backing array with either A, B, or both, as long as the indexing is the same (e.g., both are in row-major order, both are in column-major order, etc.).
        Parameters:
        A - The left Matrix operand
        B - The right Matrix operand
        R - The MatrixBuffer to store the result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if A, B, and R do not all have the same dimensions.
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • add

        public static void add(Matrix A,
                       Matrix B,
                       MatrixBuffer R)
        Computes the sum of two matrices element-wise. It is expected that the elements of R are backed by distinct array elements whenever the corresponding elements of A or B are backed by distinct array elements. Results are undefined if these conditions are not met. Note that R may share its backing array with either A, B, or both, as long as the indexing is the same (e.g., both are in row-major order, both are in column-major order, etc.).
        Parameters:
        A - The left Matrix operand
        B - The right Matrix operand
        R - The MatrixBuffer to store the result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if A, B, and R do not all have the same dimensions.
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • subtract

        public static void subtract(Matrix A,
                            Matrix B,
                            MatrixBuffer R)
        Computes the difference of two matrices element-wise. It is expected that the elements of R are backed by distinct array elements whenever the corresponding elements of A or B are backed by distinct array elements. Results are undefined if these conditions are not met. Note that R may share its backing array with either A, B, or both, as long as the indexing is the same (e.g., both are in row-major order, both are in column-major order, etc.).
        Parameters:
        A - The left Matrix operand
        B - The right Matrix operand
        R - The MatrixBuffer to store the result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if A, B, and R do not all have the same dimensions.
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • times

        public Matrix times(Matrix other)
        Computes the product of two matrices.
        Parameters:
        other - The Matrix by which to multiply this Matrix (must have as many rows as this Matrix has columns).
        Returns:
        The product of this Matrix with other.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this.columns() != other.rows().
        See Also:
        rows(), columns()

      • plus

        public Matrix plus(Matrix other)
        Computes the sum of two matrices.
        Parameters:
        other - The Matrix to which to add this Matrix (must have the same dimensions as this Matrix).
        Returns:
        The sum of this Matrix and other.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if other has different dimensions than this.

      • minus

        public Matrix minus(Matrix other)
        Computes the difference of two matrices.
        Parameters:
        other - The Matrix subtract from this Matrix (must have the same dimensions as this Matrix).
        Returns:
        The difference between this Matrix and other.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if other has different dimensions than this.
